DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text field to capture the description of the margin involved by mesothelioma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A usually malignant and aggressive neoplasm of the mesothelium which is often associated with exposure to asbestos._A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A usually malignant and aggressive neoplasm of the mesothelium which is often associated with exposure to asbestos.

Concepts.definition: A usually malignant and aggressive neoplasm of the mesothelium which is often associated with exposure to asbestos.

Property.preferredDefinition: A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for HCMI: Mesothelioma Curation Request 2.25.2021 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical._Be specific about something; define clearly.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.:Be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.
